bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON. NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of Tonka Bajlo for the Writ of Habeas Corpus. 0

Tonka Bajlo being first duly sworn on oath deposes and says: That I am the petitioner in the above entitled case, and pray that a Writ of Habeas Corpus be issued discharging me from the custody of the immigration officials in Seattle, Washington, where I am now confined at the Immigration Station in said city; that prior to my arrest on April 7, 1913, I was employed as housekeeper and cook at 815 Charles Street, Seattle, Washington; that I had been serving in such capacity for a period of about three months; that prior to such time I was employed at 917 Addition Street, between 9th adn 10th Streets in the City of Seattle, in the employ of a man by the name of Paska Bilin alias Joe Miler, which letter name is the American name under which he seeks employment; that said Paska Bilin, alias Joe Miler, is an acquaintance of Joe or John Jurin, and of my husband, Jack Bajlo; that said John Jurin while at Pittsburg stopping at my boarding house, wrote a letter to Paska Bilin and asked him to send him a ticket to come to Seattle, and that I obtained the address of said Paska Bilin, alias Joe Miler from the letter which was left in the house by John Jurin after he left Pittsburg for Seattle; that while living in Pittsburg my husband beat me so terribly, knocked me down with his fists and jumped on me with his feet, so that I was compelled to leave him and seek the protection of an American family; that I was at the home of this American family for the period of three days and my husband sent word through a woman acquaintance and asked me to return to live with him as his wife, saying that if I returned he would not be me anymore, and at the end of three days I went back to live with him as his wife; that as soon as
I stepped into the house he grabbed me and threw me down on the floor and knocked my head against the wall and beat me into almost insensibility and I was sick ans sore for some days afterwards, and while suffering from this beating after I had returned to
